Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant had a legitimate expectation to be assessed under the 'retired persons' category after its abolition
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant was underage at time of application; category abolished before eligibility date; Commission issued warnings about potential changes
Burden_of_Proof: On the applicant to demonstrate breach of procedural fairness or legitimate expectation
Legal_Rule: The doctrine of legitimate expectation does not create substantive rights and cannot prevent legislative or regulatory changes
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness, depending on interpretation of administrative decision
Procedural_Issue: Alleged breach of fairness and legitimate expectation in administrative decision-making
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No procedural unfairness found; applicant was warned of possible changes
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged rejection of permanent residence application based on abolished category
Legal_Rule_Source: Common law doctrine of legitimate expectation
Defendant_Response: Regulatory change permitted under law; no enforceable right created by legitimate expectation
Remedy_Sought: Order for reconsideration under prior rules
Governing_Rule: Doctrine of legitimate expectation cannot override statutory or regulatory amendments
